meanings.definition: To surpass in class, quality, or rank.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outclass her classmates in every subject.
meanings.sent2: The new sports car will outclass all the other vehicles on the road.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel tried to outclass the big bear in a tree-climbing contest.
meanings.sent4: His intelligence outclasses everyone else in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the sunset outclass any painting I have ever seen.

meanings.definition: To be superior to in class, quality, or rank.
meanings.sent1: The talented singer can easily outclass her competitors in the music industry.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone will outclass the older models in terms of features.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant managed to outclass the big beetle in a race.
meanings.sent5: The speed of the cheetah outclasses any other land animal.
